{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3553156,"name":"Blake Priest","username":"Mortyisntgood","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/m/f17d59/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-03-10T19:36:01.394Z","cooked":"

I am the driver for my team and I built a button box that is Arduino Leonardo based for this 2025 game. Our code lead wants nothing to do with it as he fully despised the button box saying we could just use the flight joystick, but i built it anyway. the code in Arduino ide is already done and the computer already gets inputs for all 30 buttons (yes I know overkill, its future proofed). I need help with actually getting it to work with wpilib and our robot in general. I want my operator to be able to click a button and the elevator go to L4 setpoint for example. I have experience with Arduino code but not much with frc (that’s why I do mechanical and electrical lol). thank you for the help!

30 seems excessive… theres only 12 reef stalks with 4 levels each. Multiplexing that only requires 16 boolean/button inputs. What are the others for?

For your question, there is a limit to the number of buttons that get sent in the DS control packet. I don’t remember offhand what that number is, but I really wouldn’t be surprised if it’s less than 30.

yeah im aware the amount of buttons is overkill but it might be useful in a later game. i have also found out it does show up in driver station so thats good we just have to figure out how to make it actually do stuff.

Mortyisntgood:

we just have to figure out how to make it actually do stuff.

If using Command-Based code, I’d recommend looking at the CommandXboxController class and replicating that for all your buttons. It will give you a class that returns a Trigger for any given button, which allows you to more easily, uh… trigger? your commands.

We got it to work. Turns out once driver station picked it up it was really easy. So anyone trying this in the future use arduino Leonardo with a button matrix and it will just automatically work.
